definition: Rashomon, Japanese novel and movie/(fig.) situation where conflicting interpretations of the same event obscure the truth/unsolvable case
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: The article analyzes the process and difference of Rashomon from three aspects.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分简析“罗生门”的历史改编过程。

sentences.english: The relationship between the characters in Rasyoumonn is analyzed .
sentences.chinese: 从四个方面分析了《罗生门》中登场人物的相互关系。

sentences.english: The third part examines the background and root for the difference.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分探讨“罗生门”历史发展差异性的根源。

sentences.english: The second part examines the difference from its historical development.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分论述“罗生门”历史发展中的差异性。

definition: Crime and Punishment by Dostoyevsky 陀思妥耶夫斯基[Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1]
what is true and what is fake
each sticks to his own version (idiom); a dialogue of the deaf

the truth about sth/the actual facts
